articles.author: Winni Zhou, Rae Wee
articles.description: China's consumers and companies are tying up trillions of yuan in longer-dated deposits with banks, effectively taking a vast pool of money out of circulation and risking the kind of liquidity trap that hobbled Japan's economy in the 1990s.
articles.title: Analysis: China's stubborn savers risk precipitating liquidity trap

articles.author: Ankur Banerjee
articles.description: Asian shares rose on Friday, while the dollar pulled back from a one-month peak as investors took stock of the slew of U.S. economic data that showed a resilient labour market ahead of a crucial non-farm payrolls report due later in the day.
articles.title: Asian shares rise as investor focus turns to US payrolls

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: Hyundai Motor (005380.KS) and Kia (000270.KS) said on Thursday they are recalling more than 91,000 newer vehicles in the U.S. because of fire risks and urged owners to park outside and away from structures pending repairs.
articles.title: Hyundai, Kia recall 91,000 US vehicles over fire risks, urge owners to park outside

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Oil prices rose for a second day on Friday, set for their sixth week of gains, after Saudi Arabia and Russia, the world's second and third-largest crude producers, pledged to cut output through next month.
articles.title: Oil prices set for sixth weekly gain as producers pledge output cuts

articles.author: Akash Sriram
articles.description: U.S. electric vehicle startups are expected to show the impact of Tesla's price war when they report quarterly results over the next few days, with investors awaiting details on how the companies are managing cash amid a funding drought.
articles.title: EV startups burn through more cash as demand falters

articles.author: Anirban Sen, Milana Vinn
articles.description: KKR & Co Inc (KKR.N) is in advanced talks to acquire book publisher Simon & Schuster from Paramount Global (PARA.O) for $1.65 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: KKR in advanced talks to buy Simon & Schuster for $1.65 bln -sources

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: General Motors (GM) (GM.N) on Thursday said it expected to offer unionized workers higher wages, but granting the United Auto Workers' (UAW) ambitious contract demands including large pay rises would hurt its ability to make sound business decisions.
articles.title: GM criticizes autoworkers union's contract demands

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Jacqueline Thomsen, Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump appeared in a Washington courtroom on Thursday to face charges that he led a conspiracy built on lies to overturn the 2020 presidential election, culminating in an attack on the seat of American democracy.
articles.title: Trump in court to face charges of trying to overturn election defeat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Thursday decried "revolting" practices exposed during an audit of Ukraine's military recruitment centres and pledged to fix the system by placing in charge people who understood the meaning of war.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy decries 'revolting' practices at recruitment centres

articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Last week, two papers by South Korean scientists made an extraordinary claim that sparked a social media frenzy and pushed up prices of some stocks in China and South Korea: the discovery of a practical superconductor.
articles.title: Analysis: Superconductor claims spark investor frenzy, but scientists are skeptical
